docs.abstract: New York Governor David Paterson is trying to reduce the size of the state budget by reducing the size of the average citizen. With obesity rates soaring, he has proposed an 18 percent tax on non-diet sodas or sugary juice drinks. That's a good idea for two reasons. It will raise money for health care. [...]
docs.lead_paragraph: New York Governor David Paterson is trying to reduce the size of the state budget by reducing the size of the average citizen. With obesity rates soaring, he has proposed an 18 percent tax on non-diet sodas or sugary juice drinks. That's a good idea for two reasons. It will raise money for health care. And it might lead consumers to drink healthier beverages.
